resources.string: Are you sure you want to sign out?
Make sure Sense is plugged into a wall outlet next to your bed.
Now we’ll pair your phone with Sense. Make sure Sense is plugged in, nearby, and glowing purple. Tap Continue when ready.

Before you connect your phone, Sense needs to be put into Pairing Mode.

Place your hand directly on top of Sense for seven seconds, and then remove it.

Sense will glow purple when it is in Pairing Mode.
Please select your WiFi network from the list below:
A simple system that tracks your sleep, monitors the surroundings in your bedroom and reinvents the alarm, so you can sleep better.
Clip Sleep Pill to your Pillow
Clip your Sleep Pill to the pillowcase you sleep on. You may need to pull it taut between two hands. Attach your Sleep Pill to the side of your pillow closest to the edge of your bed.
Shake your Sleep Pill for three seconds to pair it with your Sense. You may need to shake it quickly for it to register.
Sense glows to tell you about the conditions in your bedroom – including temperature, humidity, light, and sound. Sense has three different colors.
Sense glows green when the conditions in your room are just right for a good night‘s sleep.
Sense glows yellow when something in your bedroom is not quite right. Check the Sense app for details.
Sense glows orange when the conditions in your bedroom would prevent restful sleep. Check the Sense app for details.
Just wave your hand over Sense and instantly you‘ll know about the conditions in your bedroom. Go ahead, give it a try now.
Now, all you need to\ndo is sleep
Sense could not connect to the WiFi network. Make sure you‘re within range, double check your password, and try again.
Sense could not obtain an IP address on the WiFi network you selected.
The operation could not be completed due to connectivity issues. Please try again.
Your Sleep Pill could not be Paired due to connectivity issues. Please try again.
The operation could not be completed due to an internal error. Please try again.
Your Sleep Pill is already paired to an account.
\n\nPlease turn airplane mode on for a few seconds, turn it off, and then try again. If this problem persists, please visit our support site.

Are you sure you want to restore Sense to factory settings? This will disconnect your account from Sense, as well as any Sleep Pills you\'ve paired. You will need to have a Sense paired to continue using the application.
Don\'t worry, you can come back later.
Are you sure you want to delete this alarm?
If you\'re using Sense with a partner, they can create an account and set up their own Sleep Pill at this time. If your partner is not nearby, they can always do this later.
Set up another Sleep Pill now
Have your partner get the Sense app.
Your Sense is now in Pairing Mode. Have your partner visit senseapp.com to download the Sense app and create a new account.\n\nThey will be given instructions to set up their Sleep Pill.
We could not connect to your Sense. Please make sure your Sense is plugged in, nearby, and in Pairing Mode.

We could not connect to your Sense. A high-power scan can sometimes resolve Sense discovery issues, but will take a bit longer, and may temporarily disrupt other Bluetooth services. Would you like to try a high-power scan?

To connect a second Sleep Pill, Sense needs to be put into Pairing Mode.

Place your hand on top of Sense for seven seconds, and then remove it.

Sense will glow purple when it is in Pairing Mode.
An account with the email address %1$s already exists.
The name you entered is too long.
The name you entered is too short.
Please enter a valid email address.
Passwords must be at least 6 characters.
The email address or password you entered is incorrect.
Please enter your email address and password.
Sense couldn\'t register your Sleep Pill. Please try pairing again. Try moving your Sleep Pill closer to Sense, and shaking it harder.
Could not detect a Sense nearby. Make sure Sense is plugged in, nearby, and in pairing mode. Ensure no other devices are connected with Sense over Bluetooth.
The connection to your Sense was lost.
This information is used to provide you with more personalized sleep insights.
An internal Bluetooth error has occurred (%1$s)
Could not modify bond with Sense (%1$s)
Lost connection to your Sense. Please make sure your Sense is plugged in and nearby, and try again.
Operation could not be completed because you are not connected to a Sense.
Could not resolve services offered by Sense.
Your Sense is already linked to this account.
Your Sense cannot be paired to any more devices.
The passwords you entered do not match.
Do you really want to exit?
There are unsaved changes to this alarm.
We could not turn your Bluetooth on or off.
Sense uses Bluetooth to communicate with your mobile device. Please turn on your Bluetooth to continue.
Are you sure you want to pair with ‘%1$s’?
Sense\'s Smart Alarm knows where you are in your sleep cycle and will wake you up at the right time for you. To dismiss the alarm, just wave your hand over Sense.
Everything looks great. Now let’s set your first Smart Alarm.
Sense will now check the conditions in your bedroom.
You cannot set more than one Smart Alarm per day of the week.
Your device‘s time is significantly different from our reference time. From your device‘s Settings app, please enable automatic date & time, or enter the correct time manually.
You must have a Sense paired with your account to use Alarms.
Are you sure you want to unpair your Sleep Pill? You will not be able to track your sleep until you pair another Sleep Pill.
Are you sure you want to remove this Sense from your account? You will need to have a Sense paired to continue using the application.
Sense is busy, please retry again in a few moments.
Please select a sound for this Smart Alarm.
Sense no longer requires Bluetooth be turned on, would you like to turn it off?
You don\'t currently have a Sense connected to your account.
You don\'t currently have a Sleep Pill connected to your account.
Bluetooth must be turned on to connect to Sense.
Your Sense cannot connect to Wi-Fi. Tap below to troubleshoot.
Your Sense was last seen %1$s. Tap below to troubleshoot.
Your Sleep Pill was last seen %1$s. Tap below to troubleshoot.
If you’re having trouble, visit Support or contact us at support@hello.is.
Setting up a second Sleep Pill for your partner?
With Enhanced Audio enabled, Sense can pick up snoring, sleep talking, and noise disturbances.\n\nWithout Enhanced Audio enabled, Sense only looks at background noise.
A new version of Sense is available.
Sense‘s Smart Alarm will wake you up at the lightest point in your natural sleep cycle, so you wake feeling rested. Once set, your alarms will appear here.
The current password you entered is incorrect.
Enhanced audio allows Sense to pick up snoring, sleep talking, and other noise disturbances
Your account does not have a Sense paired. Sense is required to track your sleep behavior.
Your account does not have a Sleep Pill paired. A Sleep Pill is required to track your sleep behavior.
Sense has not reported any data recently. Tap ‘Fix Now’ to troubleshoot.
Sleep Pill has not reported any data recently. Tap ‘Fix Now’ to troubleshoot.
The battery in your Sleep Pill is getting low. Replace it to continue tracking your sleep.

Sense collects a significant amount of data about your sleep and the environment in your bedroom.\n\nWe take all this data and present it in a detailed but simple way — this quick walkthrough will show you how to read your first night of sleep data.
Your Sleep Score is calculated based on all the sensor data from your bedroom, as well as how you actually slept. It‘s a simple, unique measure of your sleep quality - out of 100.
The “Before Sleep” tab will summarize the conditions of your bedroom before you went to sleep.

Your timeline shows you a minute-by-minute record of your night. The blue bars break your sleep out into three categories: Light, medium and deep sleep.\n\nThe wider the bar, the deeper the sleep. Press and hold on the timeline for more info.
Here you‘ll see the current conditions in your bedroom: Temperature, Humidity, Light, and Sound. Tap a card for more details.

To see how your sleep is changing over time, sometimes it’s helpful to take a step back. After a week using Sense, this view will show you historical data on your sleep patterns. If you don\'t see any data yet, check back later.

Sense\'s Smart Alarm will wake you up at the lightest part of your natural sleep cycle - in a 30 minute window before the time you set. When it\'s time to wake up, Sense will glow and play your selected tone. Just wave your hand over Sense to dismiss the alarm.

A proper temperature in your bedroom is key to a good night’s sleep. Here you’ll see detailed information on the temperature levels in your bedroom. The graphs will fill in as Sense collects more data.
Humidity is a measure of the amount of moisture in the air. Here you’ll see detailed information on the humidity levels in your bedroom. The graphs will fill in as Sense collects more data.

AQI stands for Air Quality Index, and is measured on a scale from 0–500. The lower the value, the better the air quality. Here you’ll see detailed information on the AQI in your bedroom. The graphs will fill in as Sense collects more data.

Sense measures light in lux (lx), which is the standard unit of illuminance. Here you’ll see detailed information on the light levels in your bedroom. The graphs will fill in as Sense collects more data.
Sense measures sound in decibels (dB). Here you’ll see detailed information on the sound levels in your bedroom. The graphs will fill in as Sense collects more data.

Sense\'s Smart Alarm will wake you up at the lightest part of your natural sleep cycle, up to 30 minutes before your requested wake-up time, making sure you wake up refreshed and at the right time for you.
Sense is not designed to work without a Sleep Pill. You will not be able to track your sleep, or set Smart Alarms. If you\'re having trouble, you can skip for now, and pair a Sleep Pill later.
Your device is running a version of Android known to have issues setting up Sense for the first time. Please check for system updates in your phone\'s settings before continuing.
Your device is known to have issues setting up Sense for the first time. If you have a different phone or tablet available, it is recommended that you use it to perform the next steps.
Not enough data yet, check back later.

Sleep Pill clips to your pillow and tracks your sleep during the night. Each person using Sense has their own Sleep Pill, so if you\'re using Sense with a partner, they will set up their Pill separately. Next, we\'ll pair your Sleep Pill with Sense.
Could not complete room check. Go ahead and set up your first Smart Alarm.
Check your connection and try again.
Could not find a web browser.
Could not find an email app.
Too Soon! The alarm you set is only a couple minutes away. If you want to test the Alarm, please set an alarm for a bit later.
There was a lot of motion.
There was a lot of motion.
There was a moderate amount of motion.
There was a slight amount of motion.
You‘ll need Sense and Sleep Pill handy to continue. If you‘re not ready now, you can always come back later.
Tap your Sleep Score to see a more detailed breakdown.
Swipe left or right to navigate between days.
Are you sure you want to dismiss all tutorials?
The connection to Sense was unexpectedly lost.
An unknown error occurred with your device\'s Bluetooth, please try again.
The connection to your Sense was lost.
The connection to your Sense timed out.
A connection could not be established to your Sense.
Password contains invalid characters, or is the wrong length.
Sense does not support WEP passwords containing “00”.
WiFi network passwords cannot be empty.
